What does that mean? My hon. friend talks of a desire expressed on the part of the leader of the opposition to impose some- thing on the new provinces to which they were not subject before. I am not so well versed and so astute in reading statutes as he has shown himself in his speech, but I desire to say that I cannot by any stretch of my imagination, by any stretch of logic, by any kind of trite reasoning read into that amendment any other than a moderate de- sire to adhere strictly to the lines of pro- vincial rights and not to take away from the provinces those rights which appertaiu to provinces, the withdrawal of which rights would be a violation of the constitu- tion.
